name: The Love of My Life: A GMA Book Club Pick (A Novel)

title: A Thrilling and Unputdownable Masterpiece!
content: I recently had the pleasure of delving into the captivating world of "The Love of My Life" by Rosie Walsh, a gripping thriller that had me on the edge of my seat from start to finish. This book is a true gem that I devoured in just three days, unable to tear myself away from its pages.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: From the very first chapter, Walsh masterfully weaves a heartbreakingly beautiful tale that will leave readers both breathless and emotionally invested. The intricate plot twists and turns, keeping you guessing until the very last page. The author's ability to create such suspense and maintain it throughout the story is truly commendable.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2024

title: Intriguing plot beautifully written.
content: The characters in "The Love of My Life" are incredibly well-developed and relatable. Each one is flawed and complex, adding depth and authenticity to the narrative.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: One of the standout aspects of this novel is Walsh’s exquisite writing style. Her prose is elegant, yet accessible, effortlessly drawing readers into the story and making it impossible to put down. The pacing is perfect, with a careful balance between heart-pounding action and poignant moments of reflection.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2024

title: The Love of my Life
content: I cannot recommend "The Love of My Life" enough. It is a true page-turner that will have you enthralled from the very first sentence. Rosie Walsh has crafted a masterpiece that deserves nothing less than a full five-star rating. So, grab a copy, buckle up, and prepare for a thrilling ride that will leave you breathless and wanting more!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: A story that rings true. Enough intrigue to keep a psychologist’s diary full. Rather drawn out by the end but full of insight. A pleasure to read even if the end where alls well that ends well is rather contrived.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2024

title: Missing pages
content: A bit confusing in the beginning because you don’t know who is talking or what is going on. However, it is a treasure to read as the story unfolds. Emily could be the girl next door with her unbelievable past. A wonderful story to cherish.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2024

title: Verified Purchase

title: Verified Purchase
content: It started slowly. Then when I was finally really getting into it, at page 54, it went back & repeated pages 23 - 54. It skipped pages 55-86 entirely, resuming at page 87.  Those pages seem to be really important to the story, as they appeared to be getting ready to reveal the major secret that one character has been keeping from the other, & how the other reacts, etc.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024

title: missing 32 key pages
content: So, I'm goign to contact Amazon about it, & see if I can get a replacement copy that actually has all the pages.  As it is, I can't finish it, so I can't really review it properly. But, I wanted to let others know, as this seems to be an issue with more than just my copy (different pages missing in other copies, but still not good at all)....actually I'd rather not read something than have this happen.....but if I can get a replacement with all the pages, I do want to know what happens.  So, it's at least a promising story.

title: LOVED this book!
content: Emma loves her husband Leo and their young daughter Ruby: she’d do anything for them. But almost everything she’s told them about herself is a lie.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2023

title: Verified Purchase
content: And she might just have got away with it, if it weren’t for her husband’s job. Leo is an obituary writer; Emma a well-known marine biologist. When she suffers a serious illness, Leo copes by doing what he knows best – researching and writing about his wife’s life. But as he starts to unravel the truth, he discovers the woman he loves doesn’t really exist. Even her name isn’t real.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2024

title: A unique and mysterious love story with a shock
content: When the very darkest moments of Emma’s past finally emerge, she must somehow prove to Leo that she really is the woman he always thought she was . . .

title: Verified Purchase

title: good suspense
content: Imagine waking up to find out the woman you’re married to, the love of your life, isn’t who you thought she was. This is a twisty, turny story of an obituary writer who is, well, just in case, preparing a deep dive into his well-regarded marine biologist and recent cancer survivor wife’s past for a preliminary obit and in doing so unearths some shocking surprises.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2022

title: Verified Purchase
content: Because of Leo’s wife Emma’s fame as a former host of a BBC series on marine wildlife, his line of work requires him to prepare what is called a ‘stock’ obit, and in his research, he comes across what he learns to be lies, lies, lies about her past. What he thought he knew to be true about her life is nothing but. How can he trust her? Is she the woman he loves?
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2024

title: Love of My Life a Must Read
content: It’s not only Emma and Leo tangled in the web of this domestic thriller as we soon learn others are involved in the betrayal. Inclined at first to dismiss Emma and her baggage, once you become caught up in the mystery, your feelings for her might change. Walsh has created an immersive and utterly suspenseful book that is so much fun to read.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2024

title: It is a wonderful book.
content: I am a constant reader. I read at least 2-3 hours a day and average between 120-160 books a year. I love all genres. Obviously I read a *lot* of books. There are many books and authors I really enjoy but there are a handful of authors whose characters, plot lines, and details are so seamless and true to life it satisfies me entirely. This is one of those books for me.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2022

title: Verified Purchase
content: I will admit I struggled getting into the book at first as the characters and foundation were being built. But then it turned a corner and I couldn’t stop reading. The author put in small details that made the book a more realistic, well developed story. Small spoiler alert) Such as when Leo mentions early in the books that Ruby had been getting up after she had been out to bed every night. Then later in the story she got out of bed at a bad time at the cabin. A lot of writers would just put her hopping out of bed with no background. But for me all the small details like this made the story fuller and more real to me. The characters had flaws, made major mistakes in life, and suffered with guilt. Just like real people. And the writer also managed to surprise me a couple of times which is pretty hard to do. This is an author I will definitely watch for and read again without hesitation.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024

title: Book is missing 22 pages. Help please Amazon!
content: Everyone is different, but I thought this was an excellent book.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024

title: Missing pages
content: But it's heart-wrenchingly hard to keep reading. At the core of it is the cruelest fate imaginable. It ends all to abruptly and unfinished, but it's worth the read just for the love and pathos you will feel.

title: Verified Purchase
content: You think you're done midway through but the novel is only half over. The real story is still to come. This is a terrific novel about deception, grief, but ultimately about love. My concluding remark: Wow! A terrific story.

title: You can't put it down-
content: I read this one blind based on the rec of a trusted reader friend (thanks @kkadams) and I’m so glad I did. The description doesn’t nearly do the full book justice. Additionally, the title is misleading.  Until my friend made the recommendation, I skipped over this book multiple times as I wasn’t in the mood for a sappy love story.  This book is definitely not sappy or trite.

title: Verified Purchase
content: Occasionally, I find an author whose characters, plot lines, and details are so seamless that the work satisfies me entirely with little to no complaint. Walsh is such an author and the newest addition to my “must read” list of writers.

title: Verified Purchase
content: The story includes some graphic scenes and depictions surrounding postnatal psychosis.  Typically, I would not consider this to be an enjoyable subject, but it surprisingly didn’t drag down the overall emotional quotient.  Similarly and thankfully, the subject was handled with all the delicacy it deserves.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024

title: Don’t let the title fool you…
content: I recommend to all but it will pack a big punch with anyone who is a mother.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I have been absolutely riveted all afternoon, eagerly turning pages to find out what secrets Emma was hiding, and why—and wondering what would come next for her and Leo. This is a story of true love between a man and a woman, and a story about the love a mother has for her child. It is a gripping mystery, as Emma’s true story is revealed, slowly, heartbreakingly, and shockingly. It is a story of a grief so deep that it is a miracle for anyone to survive and thrive and forgive and heal. The characters were so real, so perfectly imperfect, that there were no heroes or villains, just people. The emotions in this book were raw, gritty, and genuine; in a book built on lies, there is also brutal honesty.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2024

content: Petty predictable. Enjoyed the story though.

title: Verified Purchase
content: After reading a terrible summer novel suggested by the NYT critic, I found this one and double-checked all the reviews.  It is about a serious and loving relationship and some secrets that surface.  The author leads us down the wrong path for awhile which was smart.  Took me a few nights to read it and I enjoyed it.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023

title: Could not guess where this one was going!
content: I expected more of a punch at the end based on how the story was unraveling. I did not appreciate that the women, who had legitimate mental health issues, were depicted with the men as their saviors, including son Charlie. I thought that the author was doing a great job with character development through 3/4 of the book but then let me down as a reader with the resolution of the story. I also regret that what could have a beautiful adoption story (which we do not hear enough of these days) was twisted by deception.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2023
